dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM. THE NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: The bedroom is small and brightly-colored. stars and movie stars and pretty photos on bed with a massive pink down comforter and beneath it. backdrop hung on sits in the dark. Posters of pop the wall. A twin something tiny  A BUBBLY ELECTRO-POP SONG fades up. Just as the song starts to get loud, just as the song sta to reveal itself as the perfect accompaniment for a sprin morning, the pink comforter on the bed stirs and a tiny h emerges, turning off the song that’s blaring from an iPho plugged in on the bedside table. Kayla emerges from the bed in her pajamas. She gets up an stretches, making weird morning sounds in the quiet room. INT. KAYLA’S BATHROOM —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: -- Post-it notes lining the border of a large bathroom mirror. Reminders and lyrics and quotes: “TRUST YOURSELF. “DON’T JUST FLY, SOAR.” “BE YOUR OWN KIND OF BEAUTIUFL.” NEW TOOTHBRUSH.” Some look freshly made, others old, thei bright colors fading. -- The bathroom is filled with steam. Kayla appears in fr of the mirror freshly showered, one towel wrapped around body, another wrapping her hair. -- Kayla gets close to the mirror, rubs moisturizer on he face, takes the towel of her head. -- Kayla blow dries her hair. -- Kayla opens her LAPTOP on the bathroom counter. Opens browser. Goes to her BOOKMARKS tab and scrolls down to a YouTube link titled: MY EVERYDAY CASUAL MAKEUP TUTORIAL. -- Kayla applies foundation, glancing back and forth from own reflection to her laptop’s screen. -- ON KAYLA’S LAPTOP - a beautiful, well-lit YOUNG WOMAN sits in her bedroom, applying foundation in close-up. The video has seven million views. -- Kayla applies some subtle eyeliner. Consults the mirro the laptop, the mirror again, Blush. Lip gloss. Kayla. He reflection. The Young Woman on the screen. All getting re together. -- Kayla inspects her finished hair and makeup from multi angles. -- Kayla grabs her laptop and pajamas off the bathroom counter and exits.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE CONTINUES
dialogues.text: -- Kayla has changed back into her pajamas and is now climbing back into bed. -- Kayla gets under the covers, careful not to mess up he hair. She puts her head on the pillow, lifts her iPhone a takes a selfie, straining to seem casual. -- Another selfie on the bed from a different angle. -- Another. And Another. And another. -- Kayla sits on the edge of her bed, still in her pajama She looks at her phone. -- ON KAYLA’S PHONE SCREEN: Kayla is on Instagram, postin the selfie of her “waking up.” She chooses a filter. She captions the photo: “just woke up. ughhhhh” She posts it. ELECTRONIC MUSIC. LOUD. BRIGHT. MACRO SHOTS: a grid of a thousand pixels, forming picture text, moving images, then closer, to the stark reality of Liquid Crystal Display: dozens of rectangular blocks of light, the SUBPIXELS, in repeating groups of three, red/blue/green, arranged in rows and columns, so close no that no image can form, no colors even beyond the three present, flashing and pulsing with abstract order: Redbluegreenblueredgreenblueredbluegreenredbluegreenbluer

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBAN STREET. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla, now dressed for school, walks down the sidewalk. H massive backpack forces her to lean forward, hands clutch the shoulder straps. She has headphones in. We follow her close, at eye-level. The world is big. She is small and moving quickly through

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ANOTHER STREET. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla walks, headphones blaring. The sun is shining. She doesn’t notice. A car passes and someone inside screams a Kayla as it whizzes by.  Kayla doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ANOTHER STREET. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla keeps walking. Stops. Takes out her iPhone and look at it. ON THE SCREEN: her Instagram photo has received zero like and one comment. The comment, from asherk1313, reads: “ew Kayla stares at the phone and deletes her photo. She look and hustles across the street. Pan to reveal, MILES GROVE MIDDLE SCHOOL, a giant brick building, wide and sturdy, beyond a large parking lot. Kayla walks toward it, getting smaller and eventually disappearing into the mass of kids and cars and buses tha are all being pulled inward toward the school. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) Your body is changing.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla walks down the crowded hallway, backpack on. Rather than the sounds of the busy hallway, we hear a calm adult female voice and the cheesy educational score accompanyin her. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) This change can be scary. But this change is a good thing. It means that you are becoming an adult. Kayla walks, moving forward, head down. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) You may have noticed hair starting to grow in new places.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla sits on the toilet in a stall. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) You may have noticed hair starting to grow in new places. Kayla reaches for toilet paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE GIRLS (13) stand in front of the three available mirrors, preening themselves. Kayla stands behind them, h hands out awkwardly, waiting to wash them. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) You may have begun to gain some weight or grow taller....This is normal...This is healthy. Kayla waits, hands out. The three girls don’t notice her. INT. ART CLASS. LATER. Kayla sits at a long, dirtied table in the back of the ar class, working on something with her hands: It’s some weird clay thing. Like a sculpture/face/mug, gr and soft and shiny and wet and Kayla is molding it with h hands, putting the finishing touches onto something that turning around nothing like she hoped it would. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) Your body...is an amazing thing. A BANGING sound. Kayla looks over to see a large BOY (13) sitting beside her, punching his clay into the table with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla waits at the water fountain, behind a GIRL (13) who drinking at it. WOMAN’S VOICE (V.O.) And your body deserves respect. By understanding exactly how your body is changing, you are respecting your body and yourself. The girl finally stops drinking, then immediately reaches into her backpack, takes out an empty water bottle and be filling it at the fountain. Kayla waits.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CLASSROOM. LATER
dialogues.text: The room is dark and a TV has been wheeled out in front o the students. We see THE WOMAN (40s) who has been speakin the screen - looking directly into camera. Behind the TV, MRS. NOLAN (50s) works behind her desk.  7. The students watch the movie with a mixture of awe, confu and disgust. In the back, Kayla cranes her neck to see.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ON THE TV
dialogues.text: Over the course of these next thirty minutes, we will begin to explore and understand these changing bodies of yours. Kayla gives up trying to see. She looks around, bored - s something. ACROSS THE ROOM - a STRANGE BOY has his head tucked in hi shirt, the glow of his phone illuminating from inside the fabric: he’s secretly watching a video. And doing something else. Kayla stares. Confused. WOMAN ON THE TV (CONT’D) Chapter One: The Hair Down There. GIRL’S VOICE (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: TRISTAN, ARE YOU MASTURBATING
dialogues.text: A silence. Then the class FREAKS OUT. Laughs and screams “ewww"s. Mrs. Nolan tries to calm them down.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. NOLAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Quiet! QUI-ET! It’s no use. It’s chaos. Boys point and laugh. Girls scre and heckle in disgust. Tristan denies everything. Mrs. No fails to control the situation. And way in the back, Kayla sits quietly. As commotion in the classroom builds and crescendos, we h something else, an orchestra, swelling and overtaking the noise of the kids as we cut to--

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla walks down the hallway. We hear only the orchestra, straining to play correctly, bum notes everywhere, sectio off tempo, instruments out of tune, the whole piece dragg and plodding along, a ton of effort, little success. Kayla walks down the hallway. The orchestra strains to sc the moment.  INT. AUDITORIUM. DAY. The stage of the auditorium, and the source of the sound we've been hearing: a fifty-piece student orchestra is mi performance, the MUSIC TEACHER standing in front of them, conducting. We drift through the students, trumpet players with red faces, violinists with poor posture, clarinet players wit split reeds squeaking out a high harmony. It’s a mess. We arrive at the back, where Kayla is stationed, one gian CYMBAL in each hand, waiting for her moment. The song ends and she smacks them together a fraction lat CRASSSSHHHHHHH. A pause. Then light applause.

dialogues.speaker: INT. AUDITORIUM. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla sits in the audience with her classmates.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL
dialogues.text: Thank you again to the school band for that wonderful performance. Impressive stuff. PRINCIPAL MCDANIEL (40s, gentle) is standing on stage.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-Alright, eighth graders! Next week is your last week here at Miles Grove Middle School. Huge cheer.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, yep, very good -- but, BUT...we still have a lot of important work ahead of us. And a lot of FUN work ahead of us. We have the High School Shadow Program early next week...We also have a few guest speakers. Should be fun. And the end of the year dance. Whoops and cheers from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, AND...we have your sixth grade Time Capsules for you to pick up today. Remember those shoeboxes that you made during the first week of sixth grade? Remember how we said that those Time Capsules were going to be a gift for the future “you” that would eventually “make it” here at Miles Grove Middle School? Well, YOU have MADE IT. So pick those up in the lobby when this assembly is over...Alright, now I’m going to turn things over to Mrs. Roach who will read the results of the eighth grade class superlatives! Hushed excited reaction from the crowd. Whispers, “yessss

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Roche? MRS. ROCHE (50s, stone-faced) walks onto the court. She stands behind a podium and reads.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROCHE
dialogues.text: If your name is called, please report to the Band Practice Room after this Assembly to have your picture taken for the yearbook.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL
dialogues.text: But pick up your Time Capsules first!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROCHE
dialogues.text: Yes...okay...Class Superlatives, as voted by you - the students. Each category has a male and female winner from the student body. Okay...Most Athletic... Danny Atchison and Olivia Elder...

dialogues.speaker: SOME GIRL
dialogues.text: Woo! Yeah Oliviaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROCHE
dialogues.text: Most artistic...Wyatt Conville and Dawn Ringelheim... Kayla sits in the crowd, picking at her nails.  10. MRS. ROCHE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Class Clowns...Jed Goodwin and Missy Vitale... Somewhere in the crowd, Jed makes a loud FART NOISE and t auditorium laughs. Classic Jed. Kayla continues to pick a her nails. Bites them. Bored, not nervous. We stay on her MRS. ROCHE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Most Talkative...Pat Druschel and Jackie Stasiak....Most Quiet... This gets Kayla’s attention. She stops fidgeting. Closes eyes. MRS. ROCHE (0.S.) (CONT’D) ...Andrew Fields and Kayla Day. Kayla grimaces. Balls her hands into fists. Shrinks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROCHE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Best eyes...

dialogues.speaker: INT. BAND PRACTICE ROOM. LATER
dialogues.text: The eighteen superlative winners sit in the Band Room amo the music stands and instruments. Kayla sits by herself. She looks over at a GROUP OF GIRLS who are inspecting and sharing at each other’s Time Capsules -- bright shoeboxes full of personal trinkets. The girls laugh and do a lot o “OH my god”s and “shut UP”s. Kayla looks down at her Time Capsule sitting on her lap - the outside made purple and pink with construction paper. the top of the shoebox’s lid, in large glittery pink lettering, sixth-grade Kayla wrote:

dialogues.speaker: TO THE COOLEST GIRL IN THE WORLD
dialogues.text: Kayla stares at this. A door opens. Mr. M enters.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL
dialogues.text: Okay superlative winners, so after you've taken your picture please return to your fifth period classes. Okay, we will start with...Mr. and Mrs. Best Eyes! Aiden Wilson-Carter and Kennedy Graves!  11. The group of girls cheer as one of them stands. This is KENNEDY GRAVES (13, "cool"). She walks past Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (weak thumbs up) Good job. Kennedy passes her, doesn’t hear and/or care.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL
dialogues.text: Aiden...AIDEN! TIME SLOWS and MUSIC BLASTS as AIDEN WILSON-CARTER (13, perfect) looks up from his phone in the back of the room. face is blank and bored. His eyes are the best. He gets up and walks toward the front of the room, in slo motion, annoyed and bored. Kayla turns and looks at him, face deflating into awe - he somehow gets hotter every ti she sees him. He passes her and the music stops abruptly and we snap ba into real time just in time to hear a faint, breathy:

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Good j-.... Aiden arrives at the front of the room.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Hey, Aiden.

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: (fishing) So embarrassing that we got voted best eyes, like honestly like I don’t even think my eyes are that great.

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN
dialogues.text: (almost a robot) Yeah... Kennedy and Aiden follow Mr. McDaniel out of the room. Ka watches them leave and then looks down at the time capsul her lap.  12.

dialogues.speaker: TO THE COOLEST GIRL IN THE WORLD
dialogues.text: Kayla gently lifts the lid off of the shoebox. She begins removing and inspecting things. A movie ticket stub. A sm frog figurine. A Justin Bieber magnet. Then, a picture of a young Kayla on a field trip with her class. She’s smiling in this picture. Surrounded by her classmates. She’s about to close the capsule, when she spots somethin TINY PLASTIC SPONGEBOB SQUAREPANTS. She picks it up with fingers and stares at it. The plastic Spongebob stares back as we hear a door open.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shhhh..-.hey....hey....I’m looking for Mr. and Mrs. Most Quiet, Andrew Fields and Kayla Day. Shhhh.... Kayla looks up. :-| INT. MUSIC CLASSROOM. MOMENTS LATER. A PHOTOGRAPHER (50s, tired) sits on a stool behind a came and tripod. Mr. McDaniel enters the room, trailed by Kayl and ANDREW FIELDS (13, silent, very weird).

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL
dialogues.text: Alright guys, just pop a squat over there and we’ll get a few glamour shots. Kayla and Andrew walk over to the “photo shoot area” -- t adjacent chairs set up in front of a hung backdrop, flank by mounted lights and reflecting umbrellas. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So we've been trying to do sort of funny poses that reflect the superlatives. Like for the Most Athletic, Danny pretended to be running for a touchdown and Olivia pretended to be tackling him. So, it should be fun, you know? You guys have any ideas? No response, obviously.  13.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh! Maybe Andrew, you could be holding a book, and Kayla, maybe you could be shushing him like you're at a library or something?

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Battery’s dead. Gotta run to my car.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCDANIEL
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. No problem...You know what, I think I’1l run to the restroom. Hang tight kids! The Photographer and Mr. McDaniel exit. Kayla and Andrew together, alone, side-by-side. Kayla fidgets with her nails, busy. Andrew stares straigh ahead, slack-jawed, teeth in braces, ostensibly brain-dea They are quiet from two totally different places -- self- consciousness and unconsciousness. They sit in silence for a FULL MINUTE. Sixty excruciating seconds. No one enters.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SCHOOL. LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla exits the school, wearing her backpack. An SUV pull and honks. Kennedy Graves (Miss Best Eyes) climbs into th passenger seat. DIANNE GRAVES (40s) shouts past her daugh to Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Hey! Little one! She honks. Kayla notices, walks over, hesitantly. Kennedy rolls her eyes. DIANNE GRAVES (CONT’D) (to Kayla) You're Mark’s girl, right?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kennedy, stuck in the middle of this, glares at Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Your dad was such a huge help with the spring fundraiser. Thank him again for me, will you?  Blue 14.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: What’s your name again?

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Kayla! Yes! Kayla, you know, we just opened our pool... Kennedy turns to her, widens her eyes. DIANNE GRAVES (CONT’D) (to Kennedy) Shush. (to Kayla) We just opened our pool and we’re having our first big pool party of the summer for Kennedy’s birthday tomorrow. You should come. Gonna be lots of fun, right Kennedy?

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: You should come. It’s gonna be a blast. Kennedy will send you an invite on facebook. Right Kennedy?

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Ohmygod.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Can you make it? Kayla looks at Kennedy, sees how unwanted she is.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Maybe...I probably can’t. I’1l try but I probably can’t.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Try to make it. You’1l have a blast. And say thanks to your dad again for me.  15.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Great! See you tomorrow maybe!

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay maybe, probably not though, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE GRAVES
dialogues.text: Say bye, Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Bye. They drive away. Kayla stands in place, staring straight ahead, perfectly still. Then, suddenly, she RUNS. We follow her, close, as she sprints across the parking lot, away from the school.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla continues her sprint down the sidewalk, her backpac weighing her down, forcing her to run awkwardly in weird, forceful lunges. She breathes heavily, running as hard as can with the weight on her back. She sprints across the street, tiring but pushing through down a sidewalk, then another street, passing a woman wal her dog, a couple kids walking back from school, she runs past them, her arms swinging to counteract the backpack t wants to pull her down. She forces herself forward. Can’t anymore. She slows and collapses onto a patch of grass, backpack first, like a flipped turtle. She closes her eyes and catches her breath, nearly hyperventilating. As her breath returns, she slowly rocks to her side, lift herself to her feet, and continues in the same direction had just been running - now just walking, head down.  16. INT. DINING ROOM KAYLA’S HOUSE. NIGHT CLOSE ON on Kayla’s iPad. Her tiny finger opens her iTune app and selects a BRIGHT CHEERY POP SONG. It plays loudly Her tiny finger touches the screen, minimizing iTunes and opening her Instagram app. She scrolls through the feed people she follows: A video OF A BOY HER AGE BOWLING, captioned: “matty getti ready to suck 101111111”. A PICTURE OF THREE GIRLS HER AG PAINTING THEIR NAILS, captioned: “friday nite nail party #GETIT”. DEMI LOVATO backstage getting ready for a show. Kayla scrolls past dozens of photos - all showing various fun, eighth-grade Friday nights being had by her classmat A wide view reveals Kayla’s Friday night: a quiet dinner home with DAD. Homemade chicken breast and green beans on each of their plates. Two bowls of extras between them. Kayla scrolls through her iPhone with her headphones in, the iPad propp up on a stand in front of her plate of food. Dad eats quietly. Kayla doesn’t touch her plate, the soun of Kayla’s music now buzzing quietly in her ears.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ...Kayla. She doesn’t hear him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: eeeee Kayla......Kay.... Dad waves his arms, flagging her down. Kayla removes one the earbuds from her left ear.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Food’s getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I like it cold.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Okay. She puts the earbud back in. Resumes scrolling.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more week of eighth grade, huh?  17. Kayla removes her earbud, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I said one more week of eighth grade, right??

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Crazy...Can’t believe you’re gonna be in high school. You excited?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You're getting a little taste of it next week, right? The high school shadow thing?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That’s fun. Do you know who you’re following around yet?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: No. Kayla goes to put her earbud back in, Dad cuts her off:

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey, I got an email from Mrs. Graves. Said you’re going to Kennedy's birthday thing tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, no.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Sounded kinda fun.  18.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Kennedy doesn’t like me.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That can’t be true.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You know sometimes kids act like they don’t like you but really that’s just cause they got their own stuff going on- Dad stops as he notices that Kayla has put her headphones back in and is staring at her iPhone, not listening to hi

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: rs Kayla?........Kayla......... He crumples up a napkin and tosses it across the table, hitting Kayla in the head. Kayla rips out her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU KIDDING ME RIGHT NOW
dialogues.text: Dad laughs, Kayla doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, I’m being funny.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: If you’re the only one that thinks it’s funny it’s not funny it’s just annoying.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (crossing his eyes) Whaaaaaat?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: STOPPP. It’s Friday night, you said I can do whatever I want on Fridays-

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I know, I know and you can, sorry. Just let me say one thing and then you can do your iPhone and I’1l leave you alone, alright?? Kayla huffs, slams down her iPhone, glares at him.  19.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Fine. What.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Okay...But you gotta listen. Don’t be angry before I even say it or you won’t really hear it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: OHMYGOD, Dad, just say it--

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alrightalrightokay -- I’m saying ite... Dad gathers himself. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I’m THINKING. Kayla closes her eyes. So frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...I...I think you’re so cool-

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (huge huff, so embarrassed) Dad, seriously, I’m gonna stop eating with you if--

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You said I could say my one thing so let me say it...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I think you’re so cool. When I was your age, I wasn’t cool like you. You have all these interests and you make all your videos and stuff and that’s so great and cool. But...You know but sometimes I just worry that you don’t put yourself out there--

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Please stop--  20.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I know, look, I know the kids at school aren’t great. I’m not saying you have to be best friends with Kennedy Graves, alright?...I just - and you're gonna think this is lame - but I just think you’re a really special person. Kayla buries her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (muffled through hands) UHMUHGUHH.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I do! Sorry, I do. You know, and I know dads are supposed to think their kid is special no matter what but I’m telling you Kayla, if I wasn’t your dad, I’d still think that. Sorry. I would. And, I just--

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: This is more than one thing.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: It’s one chunk. I’m saying one chunk of stuff...And I know it’s like “shut up, dad” and I get it, I really do, I know I’m being lame but I’m not trying make you feel bad when I say this stuff, I’m actually trying make you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Then let me use my iPad. Dad sees that this isn’t going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ..+.sure, yeah, do your thing. Dad smiles, sad, as his daughter puts her headphones back and stares at her iPad. They sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Kay, remember when I used to do Monkey Chicken Man? Kayla ignores him, doesn’t look up.  21. Blue

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (doing a funny voice, weird arm gestures) I’m a Monkey Chicken Maaaan, I'ma Monkey Chicken Maaaan. Oo oo BOCK BOCK o00 oo BOCK BA-COCK! Dad laughs. Kayla stares at her iPad. Dad gives up, for n goes back to eating. They sit in silence. INT. KAYLA’S BEDROOM. LATER Kayla lies on her bed, earbuds in, buzzing quietly, her laptop open on her chest. She is BROWSING THE INTERNET. She stares at her computer screen, her face is in blank contrast to the things she’s looking at: MUSIC VIDEOS,

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT HERE IN FRONT OF HER IN BRIGHT LIGHT.
dialogues.text: Her phone buzzes. She shuts her laptop. On her phone’s homescreen, two notifications from Twitter ONE NEW FOLLOWER, ONE NEW DIRECT MESSAGE. She opens her Twitter app. In her notifications: KENNEDY GRAVES JUST FOLLOWED YOU. She goes into her direct messages. There’s a fresh messag from Kennedy: Hi, so my mom said to invite you to my thin tomorrow, so this is me doing that. Kayla stares at the ‘invitation.’ She clicks on Kennedy’s name and is brought to Kennedy’s twitter profile. She has cute profile picture. Her latest tweet was a tweet to @awcl23: hey mr best eyes wat u lookin at lmao. Kayla clicks on @awcl23 and is brought to AIDEN’S PROFILE His profile picture is a douchey photo of him looking swe after a lacrosse game. Kayla plugs in her headphones, goes to iTunes in her phon selects a pop song, and blasts it, scoring the following:  22. She returns to Aiden’s twitter page. Goes to the MEDIA section and scrolls through the photos and videos he’s posted, breathing heavily. A selfie. A pic after practice Then something stops her. A video Aiden has posted titled STRAIGHT FLEXIN BRUH. She clicks it. It’s an iPhone video Aiden took of himself. He’s wearing tank top and flexing his muscles in his bathroom mirror. Kayla watches it. She watches him. Her heart practically vibrating. She brings her hand up to her mouth and bites her nails. Aiden flexes, smiles. Kayla stops biting. Keeps her hand her mouth. As the song climaxes, Kayla turns her hand ove and kisses it. Aiden keeps flexing as Kayla begins to full-on make out w the back of her hand, eyes closed, like Aiden and her are kissing in the rain. The music follows suit. Then, A KNOCK ON HER DOOR. Kayla jumps, rips out her headphones, and THROWS her iPho across the room. It makes an awful sound.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright, good night.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Just don’t knock so loud.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Right. Yep. Sorry. Night.  23. We hear Dad leave as Kayla rolls over and off the bed. Sh walks across the room to her iPhone. It’s screen down on ground.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Pleasepleasepleaseplease. Kayla picks up the phone and turns it over: THE SCREEN IS CRACKED. Behind the violent web of jagged black lines, her homescr is a picture of Demi Lovato laughing. The time, 11:13 PM.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Sssssssshit. Shitshitshit. Kayla grunts and whines, so angry she could cry. She flop back onto her bed, lies down, stares at the ceiling. Ugh. Then, with sudden purpose, still mad, she sits up, rolls her bed, walks across the room and unzips her backpack. S takes out her TIME CAPSULE, puts it on the floor, rips of the top, fishes through the box, grabs something, and sto back to bed. She get under the covers and lays still. The room is dark She brings her hand up close to her face and we see what grabbed out of the box: The tiny plastic SPONGEBOB SQUAREPANTS. She stares. Spong stares back. She rips Spongebob from his Squarepants - it USB DRIVE. She grabs her laptop and opens it. HARSH LIGHT. She plugs Spongebob in to her laptop and minimizes her browser. The appears on the desktop as an icon “16GB FileSystem.” Kayla clicks it. The drive contains one video file. It’s titled “DEAR 8TH GRADE KAYLA.” Kayla puts her headphones in. Stares at her screen. Hesitates. Then clicks. We hear Kayla’s voice. It’s younger.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KAYLA, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Hey, Kayla! It’s you, Kayla.  24. Young Kayla laughs. We stay on our Kayla, never seeing wh playing on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m just making this video to congratulate you on finishing 8th Grade! Woohooo! I am so, so, so, so, SOOOOO proud of you. Kayla watches, squinting, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KAYLA
dialogues.text: I'm making this video on a FRIDAY. I just finished my first week of sixth grade and I’m about to have my first middle school weekend so that’s pretty cool - you’ve had a bunch of middle school weekends so they’re probably not cool to you anymore. Kayla cringes at herself. Keeps watching. YOUNG KAYLA (CONT’D) I have so many questions for you. Are you still doing karate? I’ma yellow belt now, what belt are you? Do you have a boyfriend? Is he nice? What’s the COOLEST thing you've done? What’s the SECOND coolest? You don’t have to answer because I can’t hear you obviously but anyway, yeah, I’m really excited for middle school and, um, like, I just wanted to make this video to say great job and you’re the best and I hope you had a lot of fun in middle school and I hope all your new friends are being nice to you because you deserve it. Okay. Stay cool! I can’t wait to be you. Byeeeee. The sound stops. Kayla stares. ON THE SCREEN: we get our only glimpse at the sixth-grade Kayla, frozen in her seat, giving a smile and a wave to t camera. Her face is smaller. Rounder. Kayla Xs out of the video. Closes her laptop. Opens her p Aiden’s video is still up behind the cracked glass. Kayla out of it. She clicks on her direct messages. The message from Kenne  25. Kayla thinks. EXT. KENNEDY’S HOUSE. THE NEXT DAY. Low angle on a colossal MCMANSION. Green lawn that looks fake. Stone walkway. It’s all just big and gross and scar Dad's pickup truck is parked in front of it. Kayla sits shotgun, staring out the window away from Dad who stares her from the driver’s seat. Kayla doesn’t move. A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I’m so glad you're doing this. This’ll be good. I think you’re gonna have a lot of fun.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Mmm. Kayla keeps staring at the house, tense. Doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Want me to walk you in?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: No. Kayla keeps staring. Dad sits patiently. Kayla takes a de breath and exits the car, holding a backpack and a small wrapped gift.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Text me when you want to get picked up.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay. Kayla shuts the door and walks towards the front door. Th sounds of splashing and screaming in the backyard. The so are strange and abstract and unsettling. They get louder as she gets closer to the house. Kayla arrives at the front door and rings the doorbell. S turns and sees Dad still parked on the street. She shoos annoyed. He waves back and drives away. The door opens. Dianne Graves stands in the doorway, smil a bit too wide.  26.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Kayylaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Graves.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Oh please, call me Dianne.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Where’s your father?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: He drove away.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Mmm bummer. Everyone’s out back by the pool. Did you bring a swimsuit?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s in my bag.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Great! Come on inside and we'll get you changed. Dianne puts her hand on Kayla’s back and leads her inside closing the door behind them. The foyer of the house is huge. Kayla looks around. It’s largest house she’s ever been in.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can put your gift right over there on the dining room table. Dianne turns Kayla towards the dining room and a table pi with wrapped birthday presents. Kayla adds her small gift to the huge mass, making no difference.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll open gifts after cake. Here, let's find you a bathroom to change in.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay.  27. Dianne leads Kayla out of the dining room and down a hall towards the back of the house. Dianne opens one of the ma closed doors in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: You can change in here. And then the kids are just out back through the sliding door just out there, okay, honey?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you, Dianne.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: No problem! Kayla walks into the BATHROOM and closes the door. The pa outside is closer and louder now. The small marble room i dark, lit only by a single bright window that flickers as unseen kids run past it outside. Kayla is careful to remain unseen by the party as she unp her bag, standing close to the window's wall, out of view The shadows of the kids outside are projected on the wall across from her in sharp, dizzying negatives. The party’s loudness is intense and constant.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KENNEDY'S HOUSE. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla walks out of the bathroom and towards the bright gl of the sliding glass door. She approaches the glass. Stop Stares out into the backyard. EXT. KENNEDY’S BACKYARD. LATER The pool party is in full peripubescent swing. In and aro the pool, A DOZEN GIRLS (13-14) and another DOZEN BOYS (1 14) swim and splash and dive and yell and laugh. The boys shirtless, the girls are in bikinis. The boys flirt with the girls in that aggressive, antagonistic way young teens do. Splashing them to get th attention. Wrestling with them just to touch them. The gi pretend not to like it. A FEW BOYS play an overly-intense game of pool basketball the shallow-end, showing off to the few girls around them floating on pool noodles.  28. Kennedy does a perfect dive off the diving board, making pea-sized splash upon entry. A BOY squirts a Super Soaker a GIRL running around the perimeter of the pool. It’s a hormonal frenzy. A grape soda bacchanalia. BY THE HOUSE, the sliding glass door opens and Kayla make her non-entrance, wearing a green one-piece swimsuit. She steps out of the house and onto the stone walkway. She looks at everyone. No one looks back. She walks towards the shallow end of the pool. A boy, MAS (14, athletic) runs past her.

dialogues.speaker: Z
dialogues.text: Madison jumps into the pool as a BASKETBALL comes whizzin towards him, which he catches and DUNKS in the hoop befor hitting the water. Kayla flinches from the splash. WOMAN’S VOICE (0O.S.) Woo! Mason! Nice one! GINA DEGROSSO (40s, sunglasses) appears beside Kayla, not her.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Oooo honey do you have sunblock?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Huh? No.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: You poor thing, you’re gonna fry without some sunblock. Here, put your arms out.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: It’s a bit cold. Gina SPRAYS sunblock onto Kayla’s shoulders. Kayla winces with each cold squirt. Gina rubs it into Kayla’s arms and shoulders. Kayla stands and takes it, looking like a 7 ye old. A FEW GIRLS on the diving board notice this and laugh. Gina stops.  29.

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (ugh) Thank you. Kayla walks toward the built-in steps in the pool’s shall end. She gets in the pool, step by step. First up to her ankles, then shins, thighs, waist, stomach and finally ch The water is cold, and each step makes her inhale sharply She waddles along on her tiptoes. The water’s surface is embarrassing and perfect measurement of height. People splash and talk all around her without acknowledgi her presence. Kayla doggy paddles over to an empty corner the pool and dips down in the water up to her neck. She s still.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Hotdogs and hamburgers in 20 minutes! On the diving board, Kennedy is being bear-hugged and wrestled into the pool by TYLER (14, cute). Kayla watches

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Tyler! Seriously! Seriously!

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: You're going in! Don’t fight it!

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Uurghh noooo! Tyler sends Kennedy and himself into the pool in a clumsy tangle. They splash and resurface, Tyler laughing, Kenned faux-furious.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hate you! Oh my GOD. Kayla watches - hating it, wanting it - her chin resting the surface of the water. Then she sees something that ma her forget how to breathe. Aiden. He’s on the diving board. Shirtless. Once again, T SLOWS and MUSIC BLASTS as he runs to the end of the board jumps and does the sexiest cannonball that Kayla has ever seen. A large splash.  30. Kayla watches, mouth open slightly. He resurfaces, swims to the pool’s edge and pulls himself out. He sits on the of the pool, looks at someone, gives them double middle fingers. Incredibly cool. Kayla watches him, then: BWUHHHHH - a small, wiry boy eme from the water directly beside Kayla, wearing a wet t-shi and a large pair of clunky scuba goggles. He coughs up wa and gasps. This is GABE (12) and he is out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: All the way. Did it all the way.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Swam all the way across the pool underwater.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Oh cool.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Could’ve went further if I wanted. Gabe catches his breath. Breathing through his nose and fogging up his giant goggles.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Cool, I’m Gabe - wanna see me do a handstand?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Okay. Gabe ducks underwater. A second later, his legs shoot up the water, splashing Kayla. They flail clumsily, fall ove and he resurfaces, coughing and catching his breath again

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Too many people in the pool. Can't do it for long if the water isn’t still. How do you know Kennedy?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Um...we go to school together.  31.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Cool. She’s my cousin. I’m gonna try again-- He dips back down. Legs back up, splashing Kayla. He last second longer, resurfaces.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Water’s not calm enough. How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Cool. I’m twelve. Want to doa breath holding contest?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Cool. One, two, three- Gabe takes a giant breath and goes underwater. Kayla, a b behind, plugs her nose, closes her eyes and does the same UNDERWATER -- Kayla uses her free hand to paddle and keep herself submerged. After ten seconds, Kayla resurfaces, panting. She wipes t water off her face and looks over at Gabe. He’s floating down in the water, perfectly still, like a drowned corpse Just as Kayla is getting concerned, he resurfaces, pantin

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I won. The trick is to waste as little energy as possible. When you move, your body uses oxygen and then you won’t be able to hold your breath as long.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: That makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: PICTURE TIME
dialogues.text: Dianne stands by the pool’s edge with a digital camera.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Mommmm !  32.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Oh hush. Girls first! GIRLS! All girls by the diving board! The girls group by the board. Kayla watches.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: (to Kayla) She said all the girls by the diving board.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Right. Kayla climbs out of the pool and walks over to the girls. They are already posing together - hands on hips, peace signs, arms around each other. Kayla stands in the back, blocked.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Make sure we can see everyone. Kayla! Kayla! Up front, honey, can’t see you. Kayla awkwardly makes her way to the front of the group. few girls give her weird looks.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it. The girls all pose in a tangled, wet mass - except for Ka who crouches awkwardly up front.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Smile! (takes picture) Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Can we get one of just The Squad?

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Sure! Okay, Squad members only for this one. Kayla AND ONLY KAYLA shuffles out of the group.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great! Smile! The girls pose. They look like weird, wet ducks.  33. EXT. KENNEDY’S BACKYARD. LATER Everyone is sitting around a patio table, watching Kenned open her presents. Kayla looks on, wrapped in a towel, shivering, standing just outside the group. Kennedy opens box.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Yessssss. It’s a yellow tank top.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god, so cute.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: I know you have ones like it.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: Not in this color.

dialogues.speaker: STEPH
dialogues.text: That’s what I was thinking. Kayla sneaks a look at Aiden, who is sitting in a chair, bored, towel hanging around his neck. He looks over at Ka and she immediately looks away. Dianne brings over a smal square box.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: This one is from Kayyyyla. Kennedy looks up and gives Kayla a half-smile. Kayla give her a full smile and a little wave. Kennedy opens the box revealing a small, card-based board game.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: -.-what is it?.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: It’s a game, it’s really fun. You, you um, you take turns - like everyone gets ten cards and then you take turns doing - you’ll see. It’s like Go Fish but funner...

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: +-.Cool. The other girls contain their laughter. Kennedy puts the box aside. Kayla shrinks.  34.

dialogues.speaker: DIANNE
dialogues.text: Okay, next is Julia--

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (singing) HA-PPY BIRTH-DAY...

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY
dialogues.text: DADDD! NO, IT’S NOT TIME YET. MR. GRAVES (40s) enters frame carrying a very expensive c

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRAVES
dialogues.text: OKAY, Jesus Christ, I’1l wait.

dialogues.speaker: KENNEDY DIANNE
dialogues.text: OH MY GOD. Oh Mike, Mike, Mike. *

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMN MORNING-
dialogues.text: INT. KENNEDY’S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM. LATER. Drift through the LIVING ROOM, where the girls and boys a taking turns playing a KARAOKE VIDEO GAME. Continue past them, down a hallway and into the LIVING ROOM, where Kayl sitting alone on a chair by the window, talking on the ph quietly.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (whispering) Yes...yes, please just come. The party’s over, it ended early....I don’t KNOW it just did, can you please come pick me up please?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...DAD...ohmygod everyone’s leaving, I’m like the last person here...I’m not whispering, it’s just bad service here who cares please just come...that’s too long. Why can’t you come quicker?...UGHH. Okay whatever, fine, just come please. And don’t come inside just text me when you’re close...thanks. Okay...THANKS I said, I said thanks...okay...love you too bye.  35. Kayla hangs up. Huffs. Looks down at her phone. ON HER PHONE’S SCREEN: still violently cracked, Kayla opens twitter and begins scrolling through her feed. Scrolls do down, down - OUCH! Kayla winces, looks at her thumb. A tiny drop of blood. S cut herself on the cracked glass of her phone. Kayla puts tiny cut to her mouth. Then:

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh sorry. Kayla turns, freezes. It’s Him.

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN
dialogues.text: I just gotta... Aiden walks towards her, purposefully, cup with a crazy straw stuck in it. He her and bends down on one knee.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Wh-.... He reaches under her chair. sipping soda from a stops directly beside

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN
dialogues.text: Was just grabbing my phone. Had to charge it.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (forced) Oh, hahahah. Yeah. My phone, um....my phone runs out of batteries sometimes too.

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN
dialogues.text: Cool. Aiden is pretty dull. Kayla doesn’t notice/care. He gets

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone’s in there, you know.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Are they? Oh yeah, yeah, I was just um....yeah, I’m going in there in a second.  36.

dialogues.speaker: AIDEN
dialogues.text: Okay. Aiden leaves. Kayla catches her breath. She notices somet on the floor where Aiden knelt down -- HIS SODA AND CRAZY STRAW. Kayla makes sure no one is watching, and then quic grabs the straw and sticks it in her back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hey guys! It’s Kayla! Back with another video. Today I want to talk about - Putting Yourself Out There. She gets up and walks toward the family room. INT. KENNEDY HOUSE. FAMILY ROOM —- CONTINUOUS The kids are piled on couches and chairs, watching Z (13, big boy) who is standing and singing into a cheap microph in front of a giant flat-screen TV displaying a Karaoke V Game. Z is hamming it up. The others watch, laugh. The scene looks raucous and loud, but we hear none of it. Instead, we hear Kayla’s speech to her webcam and the qui of the bedroom in which it is being delivered. Kayla enters the family room. Stops in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, so, like, “Putting Yourself Out There”. What does that mean? Like, Putting Yourself Out There? Where’s There? Okay, these are all good questions but they’re also bad questions. Kayla inches towards the couch, stands behind it, forces smile.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cause it’s really about Putting Yourself Out Anywhere. It doesn’t matter, like, where you do it, you just have to do it. Just Put Yourself Out There. Just go for it. Kayla tries leaning on the couch. Tries a few different positions.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now Putting Yourself Out There can be really scary. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So if you’re scared to Put Yourself Out There, like, don’t worry cause that’s normal and lots of people feel that way. Z hits his final note, arms out like a diva. The kids lau and applaud. Kayla does too. Z turns and holds out the microphone, saying “Who’s next? Who wants it?”.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I used to be scared but then I Put Myself Out There and now I do it all the time. Kayla looks around, then at Z. She clenches her jaw, then raises her hand. Z notices and waves her over. Kayla slow walks towards him.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And the first time you Put Yourself Out There is always the hardest. Kayla takes the microphone from Z. She stands in the midd of the large, crowded semi-circle of kids in the family r She has zero stage presence.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But once you do it, you’ll be really glad that you did. I promise. Kayla looks up at the TV. The song starts. She begins to quietly. Not moving. Stealing glances at the kids around They watch, bored.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So, like, next time you get the chance to like play a game or sit at a new lunch table, or like, I don't know, go skydiving or something, you should do it. Kayla starts to sway back and forth as she sings, picking steam.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But once you Put Yourself Out There, things aren’t gonna change right away. Kayla starts getting more into it. A few hand gestures.  38. Nothing major. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Think of Putting Yourself Out There like a little snowball or something. Like you put the little snowball up on a hill, you Put It Out There, and then it’1l roll down the hill and get bigger and bigger and bigger. Kayla sings and looks around, kids are nodding and starti to smile politely. In the corner, Gabe watches, smiling h Kayla finally sees his face without those big goggles on. is cute like her. He gives her a very real and enthusiast double thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first time I Put Myself Out There, like, nothing really changed at first. But then I just kept doing it and doing it and doing it. Kayla keeps singing, looks at Aiden, who is texting on th couch.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And now I have tons of friends who really like me and I Put Myself Out There all the time. Kayla closes her eyes and hits her big final note.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So be brave. Put Yourself Out There. It’s the best. The song ends. She looks around. Light, unenthusiastic applause from her peers. Nothing major. But for Kayla, it huge win. She looks around and smiles, still holding the microphone. INT. KAYLA’S BEDROOM. THAT NIGHT. Kayla is at her desk, speaking to her webcam in the same clothes that she was just singing in.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: As always, if you liked this video, please share it with your friends and subscribe to my channel. Thanks for watching! Byeee!  39. She hits spacebar on the computer and exhales - happy. She minimizes her webcam’s application and opens her inte browser - it is displaying her YOUTUBE CHANNEL HOMEPAGE. heading reads: Kayla’s Korner: Advice for people like me. dialogues.text: (laughs ) Ohmygod you are literally the cutest. I think we’re best friends. Is it okay if we’re already best friends?  58.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hahah! Yeah, yeah, totally. They continue down the hall, Kayla unable to wipe the smi off her face.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hey guys! It’s Kayla, back with another video. So today I want to talk about - GROWING. UP. INT. HIGH SCHOOL - CLASSROOM. LATER. Kayla sits at a small desk in the back of a crowded classroom. She is half the size of every other kid. All the students look forward, staring bored at an unseen teacher. Kayla looks all around her, smiling, so happy to here.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, so Growing Up can be a little bit scary and weird but it’s also really good because you get to change things that you might not like about yourself and that’s good because change is a good thing. INT. HIGH SCHOOL DANCE STUDIO. LATER. Kayla sits against the wall of the studio. We pull back t reveal the dance class that Kayla is observing. She smile truly happy.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, so I’m an eighth grader which means next year I will be in HIGH SCHOOL. Now high school is a lot different than middle school because middle school is, like, really, um, like, well, in middle school everyone is a lot younger than high schoolers and when you're young, you haven’t changed as much as when you’re older. EXT. HIGH SCHOOL AMPHITHEATER. LATER. Kayla sits and eats lunch with Olivia who is chatting and laughing with her friend ANIYAH. Kayla watches, smiling, awe.  59.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So, yeah, high schoolers have changed more than middle schoolers and since change is a good thing that means that high schoolers are really good. Okay - next thing about Growing Up. Um...yeah, okay SO... INT. HIGH SCHOOL FOYER. LATER. Olivia and Kayla stand by the trophy case, exchanging num in each other’s phones. They hug, say goodbye, and Kayla walks out of the high school and into the dizzying rush o high schoolers leaving school for the day.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-yeah, okay, so the thing about Growing Up is that it’s GOING TO HAPPEN. So DON’T FIGHT IT. Some parts of Growing Up will be hard and not good but I promise that Growing Up will eventually get REALLY GOOD. I used to be afraid of Growing Up but then I realized that it’s going to make everything better and now I can’t WAIT to Grow Up. Kayla looks around, taking everything in, smiling. INT. KAYLA’S BEDROOM. LATER THAT DAY. Kayla speaks to her webcam.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Cool. Okay. If you liked this video please share it and subscribe to my channel. Thanks for watching! Byeee! Kayla hits the spacebar to stop the recording. She takes her phone out of her pocket and unlocks it. Goe her CONTACT LIST. Scrolls through the few names she has, to a contact named: OLIVIA HIGH SCHOOL. She opens the contact. It’s a phone number. She stares at screen.  60.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (practicing) Hey, Olivia!....Hey, Olivia, it’s Kayla, just checkin’ in!...Hey, Olivia, it’s Kayla, just wanted to call and say thank you for today I had a ton of fun.... Kayla takes a deep breath. Presses the number, holds the phone up to her ear. Waits. It rings. Once. Twice. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA ON PHONE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hey... INT. KAYLA’S BEDROOM. LATER. Kayla paces the length of her room, earbud headphones in. She's holding the small microphone attached to one of the headphones’ wires up to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, totally.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (voice distorted through headphones ) It’s like, honestly, like screw those girls, they’re just trying so hard to be cool.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hahaha, yeah, totally.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I mean it, Kayla, don’t stress about that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Thanks. I won't.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Eighth grade is the worst. It’s THE. WORST. I was a complete mess when I when was your age.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Really??  61.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, yes.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Haha, wow...hey, I just want to say thank you so much for talking to me. I wasn’t sure if calling you would be weird.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Ohmygod not weird at all, anytime Kayla, I gave you my number, this is what it’s for.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hahaha thanks. It’s really nice to just be able to talk to someone that’s older and cool and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Well I don’t know how cool I am. Olivia laughs, Kayla doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (not getting it) I actually think you're prettty cool (then) I actually don’t have a ton of friends at school, cause everyone’s stupid like you said, so it’s really cool that you’re being nice to me cause you’re really cool hahaha.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I made all of my close friends in high school. All that’s stuff gonna happen for you.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hahaha thanks.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Hey, I don’t know if you’re around or allowed or whatever, but me and some friends are heading to the mall to just hang if you feel like you wanna come.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Kayla stops, hangs up the phone, rips her earbuds out, an FREAKS - doing little hops, exhaling, breathing heavy. So excited.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OhmygodohmygodohmygodOHMYGOD . She takes a deep breath, tries to quickly calm herself. S picks up her phone off the bed, unplugs the earbuds, dial holds the phone to her ear, closes her eyes and waits.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ....-HEY! Sorry about that, I have bad service at my house. I’d love to hang out if that’s still- ...GREAT, COOL....COOL...Cool, yeah, cool. Okay, cool, great. See you then!...Okay...you too--I mean, me too hahaha. Yeah, cool. Okay! Bye! Kayla hangs up, sits on her bed. She smiles. INT. KAYLA’S HOUSE - KITCHEN. LATER Dad washes dishes in the sink. Kayla watches him, unseen, getting ready to approach. She takes a deep breath and steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Dad? Dad turns.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yeah? What’s up? Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: .-..-Can I go out with my friends tonight?  63. Dad stares at her. Turns off the sink. Turns back towards her. Stares. Not sure how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ...it’s a Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: --.-is it kids from school?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Do I know them?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I don’t know...No...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: But it’s Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You're always saying that I need to do more stuff and not just sit around all the time and now I finally have something to do and I know it’s a school night but school’s almost over and classes don’t even matter anymore...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ...What do you want me to say, Kayla?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Daddd.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I’m ASKING. I’m really asking you. What should I do here? I’m happy you're making friends.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I already have friends, these are friends I’ve had for a while now.  64.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Good, I’m glad, that’s awesome. And I want you to hang out with them, Kayla, I really do. It’s just, it’s Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I KNOW IT’S TUESDAY, STOP SAYING THAT.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Why are you angry at me right now??? You asked me a question and I’m just thinking about it, I’m not even saying ‘no’ yet.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Because it’s..... You know everyone else my age just sneaks out and doesn’t ask their dad if they can do stuff but I’m too scared cause I’m a loser so I ask you and then this happens.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I’m glad you asked me, I want you to ask me.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Go...go hang out with your friends.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Thank you. Kayla leaves. Comes back.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you drive me? INT. CAR. LATER. Dad drives. Stares ahead. Kayla texts on her phone, squin as if in slight pain. On Kayla’s screen, a text from Olivia: we just got here x

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla responds: cool! i’m almost there!  65. Contrary to her emoticon, Kayla is nervous, agitated. She notices her father. Goes back to texting. Looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Can you not look like that please?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Wh-? What, like what?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Just like the way you’re looking.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Looking at the road?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You can look at the road, Dad, obviously I didn’t mean that. Just don’t be so weird and quiet while you do it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (getting annoyed) Sorry.....-. so how was the Shadow--

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: No - it’s fine that you were being quiet. Just don’t be weird and quiet. Cause I look over at you and it looks like you’re about to drive us into a tree or something and then I get freaked out and can’t text my friends, so just be quiet and drive. But just don’t look so weird and sad. Please.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (gritting teeth) ...Okay. Kayla texts. Dad looks out the window and tries to look happily out the window. It’s creepier than before.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (not looking up) That’s worse. EXT. MALL. LATER. Dad and Kayla pull up to the front entrance of the mall.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Pick you up in an hour? Two?  66.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I’1l text you.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Okay, not too late...Is everything all right? You seem a little--

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ...Okay, have fun. Kayla leaves and walks toward the mall. It’s huge. Blue The sky is getting dark. INT. MALL - CORRIDOR. MOMENTS LATER. Kayla walks through the mall. The light is nauseous. Each store a giant terrarium. She looks down at her phone. A text from Olivia: we’re in food court btw Kayla stops and texts back: great! walking there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table full of friends: Olivia, ANIYAH (17), TREVOR (17) RILEY (16). They talk shit and laugh. Kayla approaches. Nervous and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Kayla!

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hey. Olivia jumps up and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Guys, this is Kayla. She’s was my shadow and she’s suuuuper chill. This is Aniyah, I think you met Aniyah today, Trevor, and Riley.  67.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: Hi/hey/What’s up.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Are you sure? We’re gonna eat I think.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, cool I can eat.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FOOD COURT. A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: The group is now mid-meal, eating shitty food court food. Kayla sits beside Olivia. Observing.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: I swear to GOD.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Ohmygod WHAT? Nononono.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: His feet?

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: No, MY feet.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: He DM’d you a picture of your OWN

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: Yesss this is what I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: He’s just trying to be nice.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: NICE?? He’s a PERRRVV.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You'd know.  68. Riley laughs. A silence. I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: What’s funny about that, Riley?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, just the way he said it.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: How did he say it?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Why am I being yelled at?

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: This is yelling to you?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Are you bored, Kayla?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You looked bored.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Trev. Stopp.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s kidding.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I’m not judging her, we’re boring. She's right to be bored. She’s a different generation.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: She’s not a different generation.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Yes she is.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: She’s four years younger than us.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: When did you get snapchat? What grade?  69.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Fifth?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: See? She’s wired different.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: She’s not wired different.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: Were kids like sending each other nudes in fifth grade??

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Ewww, Aniyah, don’t ask that.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: Why not??

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Liv, don’t kids four years older than us feel like twenty years older than us??

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Your sister?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: My sister just sucks.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Whatever, but like on top of that: we had twitter in middle school and your sister didn’t, that made us different.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: You're not different than us, Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I’m not saying it’s a bad thing. I’m just saying she had a different experience than us.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Let's just drop this.  70.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Okay, Jesus Christ, it was just like a fun point.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: .--I like the filters on snapchat. They’re fun.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Me too. Aniyah is staring off at to something in the distance, looking weirded out.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH
dialogues.text: Okay, like, don’t all look at the same time but like some creepy ass dude has been staring at us for five minutes acting like he’s not. I’ve seen him pass by like four times. Trevor goes to turn.

dialogues.speaker: ANIYAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: DON’T. Don’t look obvious. In the shorts.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Shorts?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, I see him. Orange shirt. Kayla knows before she even looks: DAD. In the distance. Trying to look casual. Kayla looks over. Dad scurries away, hoping he wasn’t seen. Back at the table, Kayla has gone white. So angry, so embarrassed. She tries not to show it.  71.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I....I think I actually left something in a store by accident. I gotta go get it.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Okay, you want me to come with?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Kayla gets up.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just forgot this thing, I gotta go get it. Kayla rushes away, head down, trying to contain it all.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MALL CORRIDOR. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - a FIVE DOLLAR BILL going into an INSERT BILL H slot. Wider reveals, Kayla standing at one of those CLAW MACHIN games. She stares into the pit of stuffed animals. Furiou Wanting to cry, wanting to scream. The claw lowers, grabs onto a stuffed animal, and lifts, grip too weak, the claw sliding off it, the animal remain where it was. He approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Kayla, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I‘1l lean against the wall, okay? No one will know we’re talking.  72. Dad leans against the wall beside the machine. Dad has to look through the glass to see her. Kayla keeps staring at the game. Never looking up. The cl lowers again. Slips again.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t spying on you.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to spy on you...I was just...I’m sorry...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I’m just a weirdo. This is just me being weird and doing weirdo stuff, I’m sorry, I just....suck.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ee ee eee I’m sorry. You have fun with your friends. The claw lowers. Slips.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Text me when you want me to pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I‘1l get a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: rs okay......

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: eeeee okay, have fun. I love you. Sorry.  73. Dad turns to leave, turns back. Takes a twenty out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here take... She stays still, doesn’t reach for it. Dad places it in f of her on the machine.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have fun. Dad leaves. The claw lowers.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MALL CORRIDOR. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Kayla walks with a small stuffed elephant in her hand. Sh walks toward the food court. Stops. Looks at the elephant, then around for a place to it. Walks over to a trash can. A MOTHER her young DAUGHTER (3) pass. Kayla makes a quick decision.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Um, I won this at the claw game and I can’t keep it so does she want it?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: That’s so nice. (soft voice, to daughter) Wow, Lulu, look it’s just like Mr. Noodles. Kayla holds it out. The little girl takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you say, Lulu?

dialogues.speaker: DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Thank you.  74.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: That’s so nice, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: No problem. Have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You too. They walk away. Kayla stands in place. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group wanders around the mall, doing the random, aiml shit kids do: - The group tries on sunglasses from a kiosk. Olivia puts giant pair on Kayla. They both laugh. - The group walks down the corridor. Kayla the shortest, smiling, just so happy to be part of all this. - Trevor rides one of those stupid kiddie rides, squeezin his huge frame onto it. Aniyah watches, laughing and roll * her eyes. Kayla, Olivia and Riley ride on a mini carous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Kayla and Olivia in a photobooth taking pictures togeth - The group wanders into a clothing store. Tries on stuff - They get cookies. - They smell candles. The group does all the silly, stupid things kids do at a mall, Kayla laughs and smiles, Olivia looks out for her, making sure Kayla is having a good time. And she is. END OF SEQUENCE.  75. INT. RILEY’S CAR. LATER Riley drives. Olivia sits shotgun. Kayla in the seat dire behind Riley. Just the three of them. Olivia has turned i her seat to face more towards Kayla. The group laughs.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Aniyah and Trev need to CHILLL.
